meanings.definition: A person or company that bundles items together for sale.
meanings.sent1: The bundler at the store wrapped the items together for a special deal.
meanings.sent2: I bought a gift set from the bundler that included a book and a candle.
meanings.sent3: The bundler accidentally tied the wrong items together, creating a funny mix-up.
meanings.sent4: She was a master bundler, skillfully combining products to attract customers.
meanings.sent5: The bundler's packages were always neatly arranged and eye-catching.

meanings.definition: A software tool that packages multiple files or resources into a single file for distribution.
meanings.sent1: Using the bundler, I combined all the images into a single folder for easy sharing.
meanings.sent2: The developer used a bundler to compress the files before uploading them online.
meanings.sent3: The bundler program made it simple to merge documents into a compact file.
meanings.sent4: With the bundler, organizing and sharing files became much more efficient.
meanings.sent5: The bundler software saved time by consolidating all the data into one package.

meanings.definition: A device used for bundling or tying together objects.
meanings.sent1: The gardener used a bundler to tie up the branches for disposal.
meanings.sent2: I found a handy bundler in the garage to bundle up the newspapers for recycling.
meanings.sent3: The colorful bundler made the task of organizing cables more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The bundler resembled a giant clip, making it easy to secure the papers together.
meanings.sent5: The bundler's design allowed for quick and neat bundling of various items.
